intro: Tagetes pumila, commonly known as the Mexican marigold or dwarf marigold, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom throughout the summer. The plant has feathery, finely divided leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine. Tagetes pumila thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ability to repel certain insects makes it a valuable companion plant in gardens.
